intro: Zanthoxylum guineense, commonly known as African prickly ash, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that are edible and often used in local cuisines. Its bark and leaves contain bioactive compounds, making it valuable in traditional medicine. Zanthoxylum guineense thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland and savanna habitats.
